meanings.definition: To make something appear old-fashioned or outdated.
meanings.sent1: She decided to archaize her room by using vintage furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a special technique to archaize the painting and give it an antique look.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to archaize their school project to look like it was from the 1800s.
meanings.sent4: Her love for classic movies made her want to archaize her wardrobe to match the old Hollywood glamour.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop owner knew how to archaize new items to make them fit in with the rest of the store.

meanings.definition: To imitate or copy the style or characteristics of something from a previous time period.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator wanted to archaize the new exhibit to resemble ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer decided to archaize the latest collection after being inspired by 1920s fashion.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to archaize the recipe by using traditional cooking methods from centuries ago.
meanings.sent4: The theater production aimed to archaize the set design to transport the audience back in time.
meanings.sent5: The interior decorator was skilled at archaizing modern homes to have a vintage charm.
